thread.title: Britain seeks NFL franchise in London within 5 years
thread.title_full: Britain seeks NFL franchise in London within 5 years

title: Britain seeks NFL franchise in London within 5 years
text:
Updated: 7:42 a.m. Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 | Posted: 7:42 a.m. Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 Britain seeks NFL franchise in London within 5 years Related View Larger Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer George Osborne, left, exchanges a rugby ball for an American football with former American football player Dan Marino, during a media event inside 11 Downing Street in London on Friday Oct. 2, 201 (Justin Tallis/Pool, via AP) View Larger Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer George Osborne holds an American football as he meets with former American football players Dan Marino, right, and Curtis Martin, left, during a media event inside 11 Downing Street in London on Friday Oct. 2, 201 (Justin Tallis/Pool, via AP) View Larger Former NFL star Osi Umenyiora, centre, and Miami Dolphins Cheerleaders pose for photographers in central London ahead of on Friday, Oct. 2, 2015. The Dolphins are preparing for an NFL football game against the New York Jets at London's Wembley stadium on Sunday. (Photo by Grant Pollard/Invision/AP) The Associated Press LONDON â€” 
Britain's treasury chief hopes the NFL will put a permanent franchise in London within five years. 
Chancellor George Osborne pushed his case for establishing an NFL team in London during a meeting Friday with owners, executives and former star players. 
He says: "I am supporting the NFL to bring one of their 32 teams to London permanently and will work with them to make this happen." 
Osborne adds that "hopefully it is something we could achieve in the next few years, maybe four or five years' time." 
Osborne spoke on the same day that the Miami Dolphins and New York Jets arrived in London ahead of their game at Wembley Stadium on Sunday. It's the first of three NFL games at Wembley this season. Copyright The Associated Press
